job_history.work_description: Chaired the Oklahoma Sequoyah Award committees which required serving as the liaison to all authors and publishers, coordinating all reading teams' activities, developing promotional material and maintaining organization relationships with stakeholders. Introduced, raised funds and implemented reading programs that allowed a notable author to visit, speak and give signed books to students at their school library (two different schools, using two different authors). Create and implement college and career instructional units to guide students and their parents in future planning. Plan and develop annual literacy programs in order to raise awareness of the library's purpose, available resources, and the rewards associated with reading. Assist parents and community with technology needs to develop and maintain relationships with school stakeholders. Design and present educational programs and lessons reinforcing 21st Century Skills for 21st Century Learners using various technology advances. Analyze data, research, and collaborate with colleagues to implement instruction supporting Common Core Standards and enhancing curriculum development by integrating instructional technology.

Wrote grants and developed strategic marketing plans to raise funds for educational programs. Collaborated with government and non-profit organizations to establish an integrated work plan to utilize all grant and fundraising opportunities. Interpreted and enforced provisions of state education and federal justice codes, rules and regulations. Effectively used books, Internet, and current professional journals to generate ideas for library purchases, significantly increasing student interest and participation.

Prepared course outlines, lesson plans and other education material that provided engaging and rigorous learning experiences for students. Collaborated with team members to plan, develop, organize and promote integrative instruction. Assisted with district professional development and teacher training.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Managed multiple projects, including chairing committees, developing promotional materials, and coordinating events, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Led committees, collaborated with colleagues, and worked with government and non-profit organizations, demonstrating strong leadership skills.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Effectively communicated with authors, publishers, parents, and community members, showing strong proficiency in communication.

skills.name: Grant Writing
skills.explanation: Wrote grants to raise funds for educational programs, indicating a solid working proficiency in grant writing.

skills.name: Marketing
skills.explanation: Developed strategic marketing plans to raise funds for educational programs, showing a solid working proficiency in marketing.

skills.name: Instructional Design
skills.explanation: Designed and presented educational programs and lessons, demonstrating strong proficiency in instructional design.

skills.name: Data Analysis
skills.explanation: Analyzed data to inform instruction and support curriculum development, indicating a solid working proficiency in data analysis.

skills.name: Collaboration
skills.explanation: Collaborated with colleagues, government and non-profit organizations, and community members, demonstrating strong proficiency in collaboration.

skills.name: Technology Integration
skills.explanation: Effectively used technology to support instruction and enhance curriculum development, showing strong proficiency in technology integration.
